item.title: Big Tech: Interviewing For Staff+ Software Engineer
item.description:
So you're an experienced software engineer, and you're looking for a change.
You have your sights set on Big Tech -- you're ready for the career change.
Or... Are you?
What should someone expect when they're applying to a Staff or Principal level role at a Big Tech company? Let's head over to Reddit to find out!

item.title: Deploy .NET Aspire Apps to Azure in Minutes | Simple Deployment Tutorial
item.description:
Want to master Clean Architecture? Go here: https://bit.ly/3PupkOJ Want to unlock Modular Monoliths? Go here: https://bit.ly/3SXlzSt Join a community of 1000+ .NET developers: https://www.patreon.com/milanjovanovic
Ready to take your .NET Aspire applications to the cloud? In this video, I'll walk you through the streamlined process of deploying .NET Aspire apps to Azure Container Apps using the Azure Developer CLI. No complicated steps or confusion - just a straightforward, developer-friendly approach to get your application running in the cloud.
Whether you're new to Azure or a seasoned pro, you'll see how these modern tools work together to make deployment a breeze. I'll show you the essential commands, best practices, and some cool tips to make your deployment process smooth and efficient.
Don't forget to like and subscribe for more cloud development tutorials! Drop a comment if you have questions about .NET Aspire, Azure Container Apps, or cloud deployment in general.
Check out my courses: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/courses
Read my Blog here: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog
Join my weekly .NET newsletter: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech
Chapters 0:00 Deploying Aspire to Azure 4:49 Examining the Azure resources 6:02 Deployment with AZD CLI 7:27 Aspire Dashboard in Azure 9:02 Deploying a Postgres database 16:40 Deleting Azure resources
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)

item.title: Cleipnir and Beyond: On Resilient Development Practices with Thomas Sylvest
item.description:
RJJ Software's Software Development Service This episode of The Modern .NET Show is supported, in part, by RJJ Software's Podcasting Services, whether your company is looking to elevate its UK operations or reshape its US strategy, we can provide tailored solutions that exceed expectations.
Show Notes "So part of what Resilient Programming is about and what the framework does is that it kind of like tries to provide a nice abstraction, a developer-friendly abstraction for implementing distributed systems."— Thomas Sylvest
Welcome friends to The Modern .NET Show; the premier .NET podcast, focussing entirely on the knowledge, tools, and frameworks that all .NET developers should have in their toolbox. We are the go-to podcast for .NET developers worldwide, and I am your host: Jamie "GaProgMan" Taylor.
In this episode, Thomas Sylvest joined us to talk about both Resilient Programming and Cleipnir .NET - a framework that Thomas worked on to implement the concepts of Resilient Programming in .NET applications. Cleipnir, and Resilient Programming, are fantastic for supporting message-driven architectures; whether you've built a monolith, series of microservices, or anything in between.
"But the idea is the same, kind of like that you try and remember the result of actions that you've done in a way that if you then start again, you won't... you kind of like you'll check in your little notebook if you already performed this action. If you did then you'll just return the result of the previous execution. If you look in your in your notebook and you can see, 'okay actually I haven't done this before' you will then perform the action"— Thomas Sylvest
Anyway, without further ado, let's sit back, open up a terminal, type in `dotnet new podcast` and we'll dive into the core of Modern .NET.
Supporting the Show If you find this episode useful in any way, please consider supporting the show by either leaving a review (check our review page for ways to do that), sharing the episode with a friend or colleague, buying the host a coffee, or considering becoming a Patron of the show.
Full Show Notes The full show notes, including links to some of the things we discussed and a full transcription of this episode, can be found at: https://dotnetcore.show/season-7/cleipnir-and-beyond-on-resilient-development-practices-with-thomas-sylvest/
Useful Links Paxos Raft Polly .NET Hangfire Quartz Inbox and outbox pattern Idempotence Azure Durable Functions Mass Transit Rebus NServiceBus Thomas on LinkedIn Microsoft Open: Introduction to Cleipnir.Flows a tool to get resilient code Supporting the show: Leave a rating or review Buy the show a coffee Become a patron Getting in Touch: Via the contact page Joining the Discord Remember to rate and review the show on Apple Podcasts, Podchaser, or wherever you find your podcasts, this will help the show's audience grow. Or you can just share the show with a friend.
And don't forget to reach out via our Contact page. We're very interested in your opinion of the show, so please get in touch.
You can support the show by making a monthly donation on the show's Patreon page at: https://www.patreon.com/TheDotNetCorePodcast.
item.author: (Jamie Taylor)

item.title: Switching Gears: Heather's Path to .NET Development
item.description:
Join us for an interview with Heather, a career-changer and Software Engineering Manager at Geocaching HQ. In this session, Heather will share her unique journey transitioning into software development and becoming a .NET developer. We'll also discuss her current role at Geocaching HQ and provide insights into her day-to-day work. Heather will also offer valuable tips and advice for others considering a career switch into the tech industry. Whether you're contemplating a career change or looking to learn more about the .NET field, this session will provide you with practical guidance and inspiration. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from someone who has successfully navigated a significant career transition!
Resources: Get C# certified​ - https://aka.ms/csharp/certification​ See event resources​ - https://aka.ms/dotnetconf/students/resources​
#dotnet #csharp #dotnetprojects #students #careeradvice
item.author: (dotnet)

item.title: My Journey as a Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador
item.description:
Join this session to hear Nicklas's story as a Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador and discover how it helped him get involved in the tech community and to build a network in the IT world. Learn about his experiences with writing blogs, giving talks, and how these activities played a key role in his growth. If you're a student interested in joining the Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador program but unsure how it can help you, this session is for you.
Resources: Get C# certified​ - https://aka.ms/csharp/certification​ See event resources​ - https://aka.ms/dotnetconf/students/resources​
#dotnet #csharp #dotnetprojects #students #careeradvice
item.author: (dotnet)

item.title: .NET Interview Insights: Tips from a Hiring Manager
item.description:
Join us for an engaging interview with Jeff, an experienced .NET hiring manager, as he shares his expert advice for aspiring .NET software engineers. In this session, Jeff will discuss the key skills he looks for in candidates, the types of questions he typically asks during interviews, and his top tips for standing out in the competitive job market. Whether you're preparing for your first .NET role or looking to advance your career, this session will provide you with valuable insights and practical advice to help you succeed. Don't miss this chance to learn from a seasoned professional and get your questions answered!
Resources: Get C# certified​ - https://aka.ms/csharp/certification​ See event resources​ - https://aka.ms/dotnetconf/students/resources​
#dotnet #csharp #dotnetprojects #students #careeradvice
item.author: (dotnet)

item.title: How I used .NET 9 and AI to charge my electric car
item.description:
Can you use .NET 9 to charge your electric car using solar power? Absolutely! In this session, Johnny will show you how to leverage your development skills and .NET 9 to combine data from external vendors by using their API's and be smart with that data to command your electric vehicle to charge when the time is right. Johnny even added some AI to the mix to be able to ask questions about the current charging state using Azure OpenAI for the LLM, Semantic Kernel to create a custom copilot, and Azure Cognitive Services for Speech-To-Text. This demo is not something that is put together for this talk, it is a cloud-native distributed application used by Johnny on a day-to-day basis.

#dotnet

item.title: Getting Started with Docker for .NET Web Apps
item.description:
I want to show you how to get started with Docker for .NET Web Apps. I will create a Blazor Server web application and add Docker support directly from Visual Studio.
I will also show you how to achieve the same using the command-line interface.
In the end, you'll be able to run and debug a .NET web app from inside a Docker container running on your developer machine.
00:00 Introduction 00:45 Quick Introduction to Docker 02:27 Install Docker Desktop 03:39 Dockerize a Blazor Server App in Visual Studio 08:38 Create a Docker Image and Container from the CLI 11:43 Course Offer & Outro
🔥 C#/.NET Bootcamp: Full-Stack Web Development with ASP.NET Core and Blazor (Code FRIENDS10 for 10% OFF)* https://claudiobernasconi.ch/dotnet-course
📌 .NET Developer Roadmap https://claudiobernasconi.ch/learn-dotnet
📌 Docker CLI Commands: docker build -t blazordocker ./BlazorDocker docker run -p 12345:8080 -p 12346:8081 blazordocker
📌 GitHub Repository: https://github.com/claudiobernasconi/BlazorDocker
📌 Docker Desktop: https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop/
📌 Visual Studio Container Tools with ASP.NET Core: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/host-and-deploy/docker/visual-studio-tools-for-docker
📌 YouTube Playlists: The FREE Blazor Crash Course: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=89Klc6WHElw&list=PLwISgxnkpZGL_LhTQCWwp-WCzupv7lcp0 Blazor: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwISgxnkpZGITT6pELfCeQ6qK0G3ujldZ
